text: Yeah I think it is, but eventually it resolves thatâ€™s not the big problem.
Have you enabled cookies in your browser?  That looks like what the error is caused by.
<@U01GW2U4WMA> everything is enabled. If I insert another js code -> everything works. If I insert the original one (it's pretty big, it contains a XML parses) -> cloudflare blocks the requests

I read some posts here recently that HubSpot has added some security because of spams that happened recently, I wonder if this might be related to seeing a word it doesn't like or something similar.  I am not sure who to ask from the HubSpot team, maybe someone else can suggest someone.
We need someone who has access to their CloudFlare account :slightly_smiling_face:
Sorry about this, y'all! Best bet is to <https://help.HubSpot.com/|report this to support> so it can follow the proper channels. If that's already been done, let me know!
Sorry for the delay - this would be one I'd <https://help.HubSpot.com/|report in to support>, if it's still an issue.
Thank you! It is; its odd because it'll break but if you create a new custom coded action it'll work again for a little bit

<@U04N6N424MB> is this still an issue for you?

I'm getting network errors as well. But, as you said, something weird is going on beyond those errors.
I tested a deal workflow that uses a custom coded action and when I test the custom coded step, it doesn't work correctly. It doesn't produce a network error, but it seems to be running a previous version of the code (at least I think that's what it's doing). However, when I enroll the deal in the entire workflow, the workflow runs as expected. So it seems to be something specific to testing the code.
if you create a whole new custom code action it kinda fixes it but ill break it again

It looks like it might actually be up and running correctly, or, at the very least, they're working on it.
I just adjusted that same deal as before, and the testing is now working as expected.
the worst part is support just kept blaming the code :clown_face:
Exactly! As they all say, they're not developers... :confused:
